intro: Pilosella lamprocantabrica, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, thriving in well-drained, rocky soils. It features small, silver-gray leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Pilosella lamprocantabrica is often found in open meadows and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments.
